characters.name: Zeus
characters.title: King of the Gods
characters.description: Supreme ruler of Mount Olympus, Zeus commands the sky, thunder and lightning. He is the enforcer of divine law and justice, feared for his wrath and revered as the ultimate authority among gods and mortals.

characters.name: Hera
characters.title: Queen of the Gods
characters.description: Queen of the gods and wife of Zeus, Hera presides over marriage, family and the sanctity of women. Known for her dignity and power, she fiercely protects her domain and punishes betrayal.

characters.name: Poseidon
characters.title: God of the Seas
characters.description: God of the seas, Poseidon rules over oceans, storms and earthquakes. Temperamental and powerful, his moods shape the waters of the world and the fate of sailors and coastal lands.

characters.name: Hades
characters.title: God of the Underworld
characters.description: Lord of the underworld, Hades governs the realm of the dead and the hidden wealth beneath the earth. Stern but just, he maintains balance between life and death.

characters.name: Athena
characters.title: Goddess of Wisdom
characters.description: Goddess of wisdom and strategic warfare, Athena represents intelligence, reason and civilization. She guides heroes and cities through discipline, planning and justice rather than brute force.

characters.name: Ares
characters.title: God of War
characters.description: God of war in its rawest form, Ares embodies violence, chaos and bloodlust. Feared even by the gods, he thrives in conflict and destruction.

characters.name: Apollo
characters.title: God of the Sun
characters.description: God of the sun, music and prophecy, Apollo represents harmony, enlightenment and healing. His presence brings light, truth and artistic inspiration to gods and mortals alike.

characters.name: Artemis
characters.title: Goddess of the Hunt
characters.description: Goddess of the hunt and the moon, Artemis is a fierce protector of wilderness and wildlife. Independent and relentless, she guards nature and punishes those who disrespect it.

characters.name: Aphrodite
characters.title: Goddess of Love
characters.description: Goddess of love and beauty, Aphrodite wields desire as a divine force capable of uniting or destroying gods and mortals. Her influence shapes passion, attraction and obsession.

characters.name: Demeter
characters.title: Goddess of Harvest
characters.description: Goddess of agriculture and harvest, Demeter controls fertility of the land and the changing seasons. Her emotions directly affect the prosperity and survival of humanity.

characters.name: Dionysus
characters.title: God of Wine
characters.description: God of wine, ecstasy and ritual madness, Dionysus blurs the line between joy and chaos. He represents freedom, transformation and the loss of control through celebration.

characters.name: Hephaestus
characters.title: God of the Forge
characters.description: God of fire and craftsmanship, Hephaestus is the divine blacksmith who forges weapons and artifacts for gods and heroes. Though underestimated, his skill surpasses all others.

characters.name: Hermes
characters.title: Messenger of the Gods
characters.description: Swift messenger of the gods, Hermes governs travel, trade and communication. Clever and agile, he moves freely between realms, guiding souls and spreading divine messages.

characters.name: Hestia
characters.title: Goddess of the Hearth
characters.description: Goddess of the hearth and home, Hestia embodies peace, stability and domestic harmony. Quiet but essential, she represents the sacred bond of family and community.

characters.name: Persephone
characters.title: Queen of the Underworld
characters.description: Queen of the underworld and goddess of renewal, Persephone bridges life and death. Her seasonal return to the earth symbolizes rebirth, spring and the cycle of nature.

characters.name: Eros
characters.title: God of Desire
characters.description: God of desire and attraction, Eros represents the primal force of love that binds beings together. His power is subtle yet overwhelming, capable of shaping destinies.

characters.name: Nike
characters.title: Goddess of Victory
characters.description: Winged goddess of victory, Nike personifies triumph in battle, competition and achievement. She rewards effort, skill and perseverance with glory.

characters.name: Gaia
characters.title: Primordial Earth Mother
characters.description: The primordial Earth Mother, Gaia is the foundation of all life. From her emerged the Titans, gods and the natural world itself.

characters.name: Uranus
characters.title: Primordial Sky Father
characters.description: Primordial god of the sky, Uranus represents the heavens and cosmic order. As father of the Titans, his legacy shaped the early structure of the universe.

characters.name: Cronus
characters.title: Leader of the Titans
characters.description: Leader of the Titans, Cronus ruled during the Golden Age before the Olympians. Associated with time and harvest, he symbolizes inevitable cycles and downfall.

characters.name: Rhea
characters.title: Mother of Olympians
characters.description: Titaness of motherhood and fertility, Rhea protected the future Olympian gods. Her actions ensured the fall of the Titans and the rise of a new divine order.

characters.name: Prometheus
characters.title: The Fire-Bringer
characters.description: Titan of foresight and rebellion, Prometheus defied Zeus by gifting fire to humanity. His punishment became a symbol of sacrifice for progress and knowledge.

characters.name: Pandora
characters.title: First Woman
characters.description: The first mortal woman, Pandora unleashed suffering upon the world through her curiosity. Yet she also released hope, ensuring humanityâ€™s endurance.

characters.name: Medusa
characters.title: Gorgon
characters.description: Once mortal, Medusa became a fearsome Gorgon whose gaze turns others to stone. Her tragic transformation reflects punishment, power and terror.

characters.name: Cerberus
characters.title: Guardian of the Underworld
characters.description: Three-headed hound guarding the gates of the underworld, Cerberus prevents the dead from escaping and the living from entering uninvited.

characters.name: Achilles
characters.title: Hero of the Trojan War
characters.description: Legendary hero of the Trojan War, Achilles possessed unmatched combat skill and near invulnerability. His story is defined by glory, rage and tragic fate.

characters.name: Odysseus
characters.title: King of Ithaca
characters.description: King of Ithaca and master strategist, Odysseus is known for intelligence and endurance. His long journey home tested wit, loyalty and resilience.

characters.name: Heracles
characters.title: Greatest Hero
characters.description: The greatest of Greek heroes, Heracles achieved immortality through strength and suffering. His twelve labors proved endurance, courage and redemption.

characters.name: Theseus
characters.title: Slayer of the Minotaur
characters.description: Hero and king, Theseus brought order and justice to Athens. His defeat of the Minotaur symbolized triumph over chaos and fear.

characters.name: Perseus
characters.title: Slayer of Medusa
characters.description: Hero blessed by the gods, Perseus defeated Medusa and saved Andromeda. His adventures embody bravery, destiny and divine favor.

characters.name: Hecate
characters.title: Goddess of Magic
characters.description: Goddess of magic, witchcraft and crossroads, Hecate governs the unseen and the mystical. She guides souls through darkness and transformation.

characters.name: Moros
characters.title: Personification of Doom
characters.description: Primordial embodiment of doom, Moros represents inevitable fate and destruction. His presence signals destiny that cannot be avoided.

characters.name: Hypnos
characters.title: God of Sleep
characters.description: God of sleep and dreams, Hypnos brings rest and oblivion to gods and mortals. His gentle power governs peace, recovery and the dream world.
